newsitem.title: USA: Fla. judge denies tobacco motion on RICO.
newsitem.headline: Fla. judge denies tobacco motion on RICO.

text.p: A Florida judge on Friday denied tobacco companies' motion to stop the state of Florida from suing the industry under state anti-racketeering laws.
In a written ruling, Palm Beach County Circuit Judge Harold Cohen denied the industry's motion, a court clerk said.

Judge Cohen had said during a preliminary hearing on the civil claims on December 6 that he was inclined to let stand civil claims filed by the state using Florida's Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act, which could mean more losses for cigarette makers.
The claims under the state RICO laws were added last month to Florida's existing lawsuit that seeks at least $1 bilion compensation for treating smokers' illnesses.
Florida had said that a victory using Rico would let the court triple the damages claimed by the state
The request that the claims made by the state under the RICO law be thrown out was made by Philip Morris Cos and other cigarette makers.
Officials at Philip Morris and the state said they had not yet seen the judge's order and could not immediately comment.
